programme.title: Call of the Forest
programme.desc: A young boy's camaraderie with wild animals comes in handy when he sets out to avenge his father's death.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: A saloon singer (Ann Dvorak) and her rival like a marshal (Randolph Scott) who cleans up a drunken sheriff's (Edgar Buchanan) cow town.

programme.title: Bulldog Courage
programme.desc: A young man, out to avenge his father's murder, prompts speedy action from the law.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Stoney is charged with stealing a gold shipment and murder of an Indian chief's son.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat goes undercover as an outlaw to find stolen property.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Homer returns to Shady Rest in an attempt to scrap the Cannonball.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: General store clerk Herbie Bates, is name assistant general manager of the Shady Rest by Kate, making Uncle Joe feel like he is being replaced.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho hope to imprison the leader of a rustling ring.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A con man resorts to murder in a phony land promotion scheme.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: An outlaw convinces the son of a former gang-member to join his gang.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt's old friend, Tom Horn, turns into an outlaw and starts a land war.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Ah Sid refuses to translate a map brought to him by Fallon and Keats; Ah Sid escapes their attack to be befriended by Judge Roy Bean.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Judge Bean suspects that Doc Malone's medicine show could be harboring a notorious killer.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: A notorious outlaw arrives during an election to shed a bad light on his brother, an honest lawyer running for office.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: The son (Stuffy Singer) of a slain deputy has suspicions about his caregiver (Leonard Penn), a reformed outlaw.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Little Snowbird falls into a deep trance after Hawkeye presents her with a doll.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Ever since Lt. Smith joined Col. Courtney's command, unexplained Indian deaths have increased and threatens to ignite a war between the colonial forces and the Iroquois nation.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A wanderer seeking his parents' lynchers, arrives in Virginia City as Ben and Adam are convicted of murder.

programme.title: Leather Burners
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy (William Boyd) helps his friend Johnny (Jay Kirby) find out where rustlers are hiding stolen cattle.

programme.title: Prairie Pals
programme.desc: Deputies must save a scientist from kidnappers.

programme.title: Bad Man of Deadwood
programme.desc: A cowboy (Roy Rogers) hides from his past in a fake professor's (George "Gabby" Hayes) medicine show and helps town outcasts fight civic reformers.

programme.title: Colorado
programme.desc: Lieutenant Jerry Burke (Roy Rogers) is sent to Colorado to track down a troublesome gang. When he finally catches them, he finds out his traitorous brother commands them.

programme.title: Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: During the 1889 land rush, a cowboy is accused of staking a claim prior to the official starting time.

programme.title: Randy Rides Alone
programme.desc: Government agent Randy Bowers (John Wayne) is accused of shooting up a saloon and has to escape from the jail to find the man behind the murders.

programme.title: The Sundowners
programme.desc: Texas brothers (Robert Preston, Robert Sterling) feud over land and cattle, with a younger brother between them.

programme.title: Loser's End
programme.desc: A cowboy (Jack Perrin) and his sidekick (Frank Rice) pursue a gang of smugglers and save a Mexican dancer (Tina Menard).

programme.title: Fighting Westerner
programme.desc: Heirs of a radium mine owner face murder attempts. A mining engineer investigates to find the killer and prove his cousin's innocence. The mine's value motivates the crimes.

programme.title: The Gunman From Bodie
programme.desc: The Rough Riders (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) act like strangers to catch a crooked lawyer.

programme.title: The Red Rope
programme.desc: Ranch hand Tom Shaw (Bob Steele) must face off against a nefarious gunslinger to save his lady love's ranch..
